post_text:
The Red Hook Central School District Board of Education is pleased to announce the appointment of Janet Warden to the position of Superintendent of Schools. She will begin July 1, 2020. The Board would like to thank the whole community for its patience and participation in the search process. We feel confident that Ms. Warden will competently engage with our faculty, staff, students, administration and families during this unprecedented time of insecurity and change. She is eager to begin working with our school community. She has provided us with this video to introduce herself to us all. We are looking forward to having her join us in July.

RHCSD Board of Education

#TBT has us remembering this fall's RHHS Hardscrabble Players' production of Harold Pinter's work "Betrayal". The play depicts the unraveling of three connected lives. The cast included three talented student actors - Gavin McGee, Micah Schultheis and Guinevere Thorn. Fall Drama Advisor, Rob Carruthers, expressed his admiration for the cast and crew. “I cannot explain the level of pride I feel in what these students accomplished. With only a month of rehearsals, they furiously worked to ingest, understand, and appreciate this complex work,” he said.

With the construction of the new RHHS auditorium underway, some unique decisions regarding staging and performance had to be made. The actors occupied a stage set up on risers on the gym floor. All three actors remained on stage for the entire play while changes in time were highlighted by musical selections to match the plot and setting. The show was produced by RHHS faculty member Matthew Funigiello.

Up next: the RHHS spring musical - Fiddler on the Roof. Performance dates - March 19 - 22. We hope to see you in the audience!

Elementary Bus Transportation - Change in Procedure

The district will continue to offer parents the option to have their child(ren) transported to other established bus stops in the afternoon for certain activities (e.g., playdates, babysitters, etc.). We will, however, be implementing one important process change for the coming school year:

Parents must submit, in writing, bus change requests in the morning before 10 a.m. For safety and security reasons, we will no longer be taking verbal requests for bus changes over the phone.

While Red Hook CSD continues to be relatively unique among school districts in honoring a variety of transportation changes, parents should limit the number of changes. Thank you for your understanding.
